critique: The document establishes the President's Economic Recovery Advisory Board (PERAB) within the Department of the Treasury. The PERAB is designed to provide independent, nonpartisan information, analysis, and advice to the President on economic recovery. The board consists of no more than 17 members appointed by the President from outside the government, reflecting diverse perspectives. The PERAB's functions are advisory, including soliciting information, reporting on policies, and providing analysis on the economy and financial system. The document emphasizes cooperation from executive departments and agencies, with the Department of the Treasury providing funding and administrative support. The PERAB terminates two years after the order unless extended by the President. The document includes general provisions ensuring compliance with applicable law and stating that it does not create enforceable rights.
